properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 12:36AM PST until January 9 at 2:30AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County

A cold front moved east of the area Tuesday evening. Precipitation
rates decreased significantly behind the front. Snow levels have
lowered down to around 3000 feet and will continue to lower today.
The lower reaches of the Chehalis river will crest later today
into Thursday. The Skookumchuck near Bucoda will continue to recede
today.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Chehalis River Above Grand Mound
* Until late tonight.
* At 12:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 142.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 141.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river crested at 142.3 feet at 12 AM Wednesday and
will continue to fall to below flood stage this evening.
* Impact...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will
flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road...
Independence Road and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover
nearby farm lands.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
